description: From Middle English arrogaunt, from Old French arrogant, from Latin arrogāns, present active participle of arrogō.

adjectives.description: arrogant (comparative more arrogant, superlative most arrogant)

entries.meaning: Having excessive pride in oneself, often with contempt or disrespect for others.
examples: Synonyms: authoritarian, cocky, conceited, condescending, disdainful, egotistical, high-handed, narcissistic, overbearing, presumptuous, supercilious, stuck up, proud, vain
